title: Drawing, "Masts of Ship with United States Flag", October 17, 1897
medium: Graphite on off-white thin board; guest card of The Pittsburgh Club
markings: Stamped at lower right (upside-down, in faded ink): Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union. [Lugt 457d]
inscribed:
Recto: across top in graphite, then crossed out:  many experiments
upper right in graphite:  that this was so [underlined] / as I remember it / "Oct. 17 '97" [crossed out].
at lower right in graphite:  Before scraping
at lower left in graphite:  From Atlantic.... SK

Verso: Inscribed in black ink on printed invitation: Mr. Winslow Homer (in ink) /  The Pittsburgh Club / at the request of / Mr. [crossed out] The Board of Governors (in ink) / respectfully tender to you the privileges / of their Club House for fifteen days.  / 125 Penn Ave.  / Oct. 12, 1897 (in ink) 
lower right  in  graphite: (252) (upsidedown).
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description: A sketch (from memory?) with a composition of disassociated elements: at left a ship with three masts, from whose rightmost mast flies an inverted United States flag; at lower left foreground, two men push a dory on a carriage (compare with "The Wreck") towards rocks and grass, in the right distance, a hill or rise is implied. At right, numerous manuscript notations.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Masts of Ship with United States Flag", October 17, 1897.
October 17, 1897. Graphite on off-white thin board; guest card of The Pittsburgh Club. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-252.
